column4: I am running ubuntu 6.10 and have two different wireless cards that I can use
I know the name and pswd for my wireless modem
and enter them into the wireless profiles for each card
(one at a time, or together, it makes no difference)
despite ubuntu recognizing that I have wireless cards, I can not access the network
there is nothing to block people accessing the network
and my other operating systems on the computer can use those cards to access it
can I get it without having ubuntu attached to the internet
(like a seperate download that I can get with windows?)
and get the right version for your Ubuntu ( the edgy or dapper one etc)
read the docs ubotu posted
and come back with more specific questions if needed :)
try emoving the configurations, and install network-manager-gnome
ah, catch 22
yes, try packages.ubuntu.com
make sure you get the dependencies as well ( network-manager and nm-applet I think)
6.10 is edgy eft
the main issue with wireless in Linux is drivers - some are not supported although ndiswrapper might help
how can I test ndiswrapper and what can it do?
it basically acts as a linux wrapper for windows drivers
I suggest that you read the wifi wiki docs
any of them? all of them?
first find out if your chipset is supported or not :)
